name: fordable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of an area in a river or stream) not deep and able to be crossed on foot or in a vehicle : The river wasn't fordable because of all the recent rainfall. The stream was normally fordable by vehicles or on horseback. See
ford
More examplesFewer examplesThe creek is easily fordable at almost any point.If the stream below is fordable, head steeply down a rocky track to ford it.They reported the river to be "low and fordable in many places".
